item.title: 桑坦德银行贷款收入保持增长，利润超出预期
item.description: 桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）第三季度利润好于预期，因为该银行的利息收入持续增长，手续费收入也在增加。【原文：Banco Santander SA posted better-than-expected profit in the third quarter, as the lender saw continued growth in interest income and rising revenue from fees.】

item.title: 汇丰银行奖金池有望追平去年的十年最高纪录
item.description: 汇丰控股公司的银行家们有望分享到 2024 年的奖金池，其价值至少相当于去年的约 38 亿美元。【原文：Bankers at HSBC Holdings Plc can expect to share a bonus pool for 2024 worth at least as much as last year’s haul of about $3.8 billion.】

item.title: 高盛所罗门 "担忧 "中东冲突扩大
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s Chief Executive David Solomon expressed concern about the widening conflict in the Middle East even though it hasn’t had a significant impact on business yet.】

item.title: 新加坡淡马锡称特朗普胜选将拖累全球经济增长
item.description: 新加坡国有投资公司警告说，唐纳德-特朗普赢得大选不一定对世界经济和金融市场有利。【原文：Singapore’s state-owned investment firm is warning that a Donald Trump election victory might not necessarily be a plus for the world economy and financial markets.】

item.title: 亿万富翁卢的卓越投资公司因服装销售大涨
item.description: 在所罗门-卢的 Premier Investments Ltd. 同意将旗下服装品牌出售给迈尔控股有限公司（Myer Holdings Ltd. ）后，该公司股价飙升，这笔交易巩固了这位亿万富翁在澳大利亚零售业的主导地位。【原文：Shares of Solomon Lew’s Premier Investments Ltd. soared after the company agreed to sell its apparel brands to Myer Holdings Ltd. in a deal that cements the billionaire’s dominance across Australian retail.】

item.title: 高盛所罗门对交易前景持乐观态度
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s top executive sounded a bullish note on the outlook for dealmaking, singling out investments in technology as a bright spot.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯 FII8：高盛所罗门对交易前景持乐观态度
item.description:
【原文：

   

】

item.title: 对冲基金买入美元和日本股市，押注特朗普大胜
item.description: 对冲基金 Vantage Point Asset Management 正在增持日本股票和美元，押注唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将在下周的美国总统大选中大获全胜。【原文：Hedge fund Vantage Point Asset Management is boosting exposure to Japanese stocks and the dollar, betting on a big win for Donald Trump in next week’s US presidential election.】

item.title: 波音公司增资 210 亿美元以增强流动性
item.description: 波音公司（Boeing Co. ）在一次规模更大的股票出售中筹集了约 210 亿美元的资金，这是上市公司有史以来规模最大的股票出售之一，从而在消耗现金的同时巩固了资产负债表。【原文：Boeing Co. raised around $21 billion in an upsized share sale, one of the largest ever by a public company, shoring up its balance sheet as it burns through cash.】

item.title: 汇丰银行：中国经济刺激措施推动香港交易量增长
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）表示，在中国推出刺激经济的措施后，交易活动更加活跃，促进了客户交易。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc signaled stronger trading activity after China unveiled stimulus measures to spur its economy, boosting client transactions.】

item.title: 高盛在利雅得巨型金融区开设办事处
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has opened a new office in the financial district of Saudi Arabia’s capital Riyadh, deepening its presence in the largest Middle Eastern economy.】

item.title: 英国能源行业在免费电力争夺战中出现分歧
item.description:
随着政府决定是否在各地区之间拆分电力定价，战线正在拉开。【原文：

Battle lines are being drawn as the government decides if it will split power pricing across regions.

】

item.title: 德国执政联盟可能已经悄然退出
item.description: 德国执政联盟仍在执政，但三党联盟目前只是徒有虚名。【原文：Germany’s ruling coalition is still in power, but the three-party alliance currently exists in little more than name.】

item.title: 投资者关注南非预算案，期待采取进一步改革措施
item.description: 南非新联合政府将于本周三公布其首份预算，届时将对其控制债务和加快改革以重振乏力经济的决心进行考验。【原文：The new South African coalition government’s resolve to control debt and expedite reforms to fire up the lackluster economy will be put to the test when it unveils its first budget on Wednesday.】

item.title: 阿布扎比公司缺席 FII 显示与利雅得的竞争
item.description: 在大卫-所罗门（David Solomon）和拉里-芬克（Larry Fink）等金融界最具影响力的人物前往利雅得参加沙特阿拉伯的旗舰活动 "未来投资倡议 "之际，有一个群体迄今为止明显缺席。议程中几乎没有来自邻国阿布扎比的与会者。【原文：As the most influential names from the world of finance, including David Solomon and Larry Fink, head to Riyadh for Saudi Arabia’s flagship Future Investment Initiative, one cohort has so far been notably absent. The agenda features almost no attendees from neighboring Abu Dhabi.】

item.title: 2016 年特朗普贸易与现在有何不同
item.description:
较高的利率和本已昂贵的股票将降低市场上涨的上限。【原文：

Higher interest rates and already-expensive stocks will put a lower ceiling on any market advance.

】

item.title: 尽管中国大力推行经济刺激政策，但库存增加导致铁矿石价格下跌
item.description: 铁矿石从两周来的最高收盘价回落，原因是炼钢原料的最大进口国中国的港口库存上升。【原文：Iron ore retreated from the highest close in two weeks on rising port inventories in China, the biggest importer of the steelmaking ingredient.】

item.title: 大选失利后，日本推动芯片发展失去重要支持者
item.description: 自民党重量级人物安倍昭惠在日本大选中落败，芯片业最大的支持者之一被赶出了议会，人们对纳税人投入芯片业的资金越来越担忧。【原文：Liberal Democratic Party heavyweight Akira Amari’s defeat in Japan’s general election removes from parliament one of the chip sector’s biggest advocates as concerns grow over the amount of taxpayer money getting plowed into the industry.】

item.title: 美的、海尔在中国抢购冰箱和洗衣机，股价大涨
item.description: 中国为刺激消费而采取的以旧换新政策取得了双重成功：9 月份，家电产品的销售量激增，投资者纷纷买入家电生产商的股票。【原文：When it comes to China’s trade-in policy to boost consumer spending, the success is coming two-fold: Sales of home appliances surged in September, and investors are buying up shares of their producers.】

item.title: 以 60 美元起家的大亨在印度上市后身价达 50 亿美元
item.description: 1985 年，Hitesh Chimanlal Doshi 利用亲戚提供的 5000 卢比（60 美元）贷款开始涉足印度能源行业。【原文：Hitesh Chimanlal Doshi started dabbling in India’s energy sector in 1985 using a 5,000 rupees ($60) loan from a relative.】

item.title: 中国市场大转移，苹果从印度发货 60 亿美元 iPhone
item.description: 截至 9 月份的 6 个月里，苹果公司从印度出口的 iPhone 激增了三分之一，这凸显出苹果公司正努力扩大在印度的生产规模，减少对中国的依赖。【原文：Apple Inc.’s iPhone exports from India jumped by a third in the six months through September, underscoring its push to expand manufacturing in the country and reduce dependence on China.】

item.title: 中国钴王提前数月实现产量目标
item.description: 全球第一大钴矿生产商上一季度实现了全年产量目标，其快速增长对全球电池材料价格造成了压力。【原文：The world’s No. 1 cobalt miner smashed through its full-year output target last quarter after a speedy ramp-up that’s piled pressure on global prices of the battery material.】

item.title: 中国电动汽车股票大涨，政府有望加大购买力度
item.description: 在国家媒体报道了政府支持电动汽车行业发展的措施后，中国电动汽车股票在香港大涨。【原文：Chinese electric-vehicle stocks rallied in Hong Kong after state media reported on government measures to support the sector’s development.】

item.title: 中国电动车销售信号预示年末销售盛宴：超速驾驶
item.description: 中国的电动汽车制造商有望实现雄心勃勃的年度销售目标，因为他们已从激烈的价格战中脱颖而出，成为世界上最大汽车市场中严重受伤的传统外国品牌的胜利者。【原文：China’s electric vehicle makers are on track to hit ambitious annual sales targets as they emerge as the victors from an intense price war that’s seriously wounded legacy foreign brands in the world’s biggest auto market.】

item.title: Waaree 首次亮相推动印度可再生能源股票反弹
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 普洛斯以创纪录的两位数票息出售美元债券
item.description: 普洛斯私人有限公司在一份声明中表示，由于需求不足以达到定价目标，该公司将不再发行美元债券。【原文：GLP Pte will not proceed with its dollar bond issuance as demand is not sufficient to reach its pricing goal, the logistics real estate developer said in a statement.】

item.title: 立邦涂料达成 23 亿美元交易，股价创 24 年来最大涨幅
item.description: 立邦涂料控股公司（Nippon Paint Holdings Co.【原文：Shares of Nippon Paint Holdings Co. surged following its announcement of a deal to acquire a US-based chemicals formulator.】

item.title: 关注美国关键数据和大选结局，黄金走势平稳
item.description: 黄金小幅下跌，原因是交易商正在准备重要的经济数据，这些数据将有助于为美联储下一步的政策决定奠定基础，同时美国总统大选继续进入倒计时。【原文：Gold held a modest decline as traders prepared for key economic data that will help to set the stage for the next Federal Reserve policy decision, while the countdown to the US presidential election continued.】

item.title: 布雷特-泰勒的人工智能初创公司 Sierra 估值 45 亿美元
item.description: 由 OpenAI 主席布雷特-泰勒（Bret Taylor）和 Alphabet 公司前高管克莱-巴弗（Clay Bavor）创立的人工智能初创公司 Sierra Technologies Inc.【原文：Sierra Technologies Inc., the artificial intelligence startup founded by OpenAI Chairman Bret Taylor and former Alphabet Inc. executive Clay Bavor, has raised $175 million in a financing round that values the company at $4.5 billion.】

item.title: 贝索斯称《邮报》拒绝为其背书是为了消除 "信誉差距
item.description: 亚马逊公司创始人、《华盛顿邮报》的所有者杰夫-贝索斯（Jeff Bezos）表示，该报停止为总统候选人背书的决定解决了困扰媒体行业的 "信誉差距 "问题。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. founder Jeff Bezos, the owner of the Washington Post, said the newspaper’s decision to stop endorsing presidential candidates addresses a “credibility gap” afflicting the media industry.】
